name: brass bangle bracelet
description:
this is a heavy brass bangle with an absolutely winning design - adorned with a foliate and peacock pattern - it's size and style make it a true statement piece

-1 3/4" high/opening is 2 5/8" in diameter

name: holiday dessert plate set
description:
a set of four porcelain dessert plates with illustrated flowers on "fabric" ground - they have a "vintage" look - while being both dishwasher and microwave safe

- each plate  is 8 1/2" in diameter
- set comes packaged in a linen gift box

name: two little vintage monkeys
description:
these two wooden monkeys with moveable parts, are a childhood classic 

- each 4 1/2" high

name: vintage mexican lidded pots
description:
selling as a pair, these vintage terra cotta pots are exuberantly painted by hand in a mexican folk style - the weathered surface only adds to the charm

- larger 9" diameter x 9 1/2" ht./smaller 7" diameter x 7 1/2" ht.
- not food safe
- small chip on lid of smaller pot

name: a vintage decoupage cigar band piece
description:
for the cigar lover in your life - a circa 1920's/30's dish featuring numerous vintage cigar bands under glass, with a felt covered base.

- 5 1/2" in diameter

name: vintage Indian sequin and applique textile
description:
pure magic - a vintage Indian textile - circa 1950's/60's - full of color and whimsy - sequins, mirrors and layered fabric
recently attached to a panel of heavier fabric to stabilize and mounted on a 1 3/4" squared wooden rod for hanging
loss of some sequins, some color fading associated with normal wear and tear

name: a striking, large modern still life
description:
an abstract still life, circa 1950s, that came out of Allentown, Pa, signed in pencil on stretcher, D.Ratcliff - a pottery vase filled with flowers, fruit and hanging painting?, rendered in bold colors with a palette knife

- 30" ht. x 36" wd.
- oil on linen 
- tiny tear lower left/paint cracks midpoint on right/several small losses - selling as is

name: a pair of 1960's enamel bird paintings
description:
these are charming and colorful enamel paintings, mounted on wood plaques, of stylized birds - one alone and one with nestlings, circa 1960

- 11 1/8" ht. x 9" wd. in full/7 1/8" ht. x 5 1/2" wd. artwork alone
- each signed with initials JD lower left

name: a large vintage painting of a horse
description:
dating from the 1930's - 40's, this charming one-of-a-kind piece, is a portrait of what must have been a favorite horse/pony?, in a rural landscape with a farm in background, all exuberantly painted on a wooden gate - still bearing the original hardware. Signed in small script, lower right - it would make a fabulous addition to a child's room - either hung on a wall or used as a headboard

- 77 1/2" wd. x 42" ht. (stands on 6" legs)
- obvious paint loss due to age and probable exposure to the elements - we had it sealed to prevent flaking
- requires transport - please phone for quote

name: a covered bottle with a four seasons motif from the 60's
description:
a really quirky covered bottle - c. 1960's - the bottle is clear glass and is wrapped in a hand sewn leather cover with dyed leather details depicting the seasons on each of four sides

- a snowman represents winter, flowers for spring, a sun for summer and         berries for autumn
- braided leather detail on all corners  
- a decorated leather cap is attached with a braided cord
- 7" ht. x roughly 3" square

name: a wool paisley shawl
description:
these are pure 100% wool woven into exquisite paisleys that wear beautifully over the shoulders or can be tossed on the back of a sofa as a lightweight throw

- 40" x 80" currently available in maroon/lime, teal/blue
- 24" x 80" currently available in maroon/indigo
- reversible
- dry clean only

sale items cannot be returned

name: a wool paisley shawl in teal and blue
description:
these are 100% pure wool, woven into exquisite paisleys that wear beautifully over the shoulders or can be tossed on the back of a sofa as a lightweight throw

- 40" x 80" 
- reversible
- dry clean only

sale items cannot be returned

name: a wool paisley shawl in maroon and indigo
description:
these are 100% wool, woven into exquisite paisleys that wear beautifully over the shoulders or can be tossed on the back of a sofa as a lightweight throw

- 24" x 80"
- reversible
- dry clean only

sale items cannot be returned

name: an exotic footed box
description:
this is a lavish antique box, richly adorned with colored glass and old gilding, circa 1920s or 30s - possibly Indian - it's the kind of piece that, standing alone, or filled with books or candles, adds extraordinary style to any room

- 26 1/4" wd. x 13" ht. x 9 1/4" dp.
- the top is hinged and opens fully
- the only notable loss is a small piece missing from one foot
- old repair to underside of top

name: a pair of magnificent brass vases
description:
this pair of vintage indian brass vases would make a truly elegant statement - in beautiful condition with decoration in black and red paint

- they stand 24 5/8" ht./8" wd.
- incised on base - made in india
- removable fluted caps
- some tiny surface marks

name: "nature mort" a vintage still life
description:
a painting of fruit and vegetables in a footed bowl, the classic still life subject, rendered in a flat, primitive style, circa 1940's/50's - with a bright blue band at bottom with french script, "Fruits - Legumes - Nature Mort", tiny white star upper left

- 16" ht. x 20" wd.
- oil on canvas
- stamped on stretchers, "Artist's Supply Co. Chicago, Illinois"

name: an original lithograph "owl in flight" by the american artist jack coughlin
description:
an admission here that you will certainly pick up on if you explore this site - we're big on owls - just drawn to them - and this is a remarkable rendering by the noted american artist jack coughlin 

- signed and numbered by jack coughlin in pencil along the lower margin 
- #238 from an edition of 250
- published by the Associated American Artists, New York
- c. 1970
- image 10 1/2" x 14 1/2"
- 16 3/4" x 20 3/4" with mat and frame

name: a little folkloric donkey from mexico
description:
there something so completely captivating about vintage mexican folk art - this little guy was hand painted in the tonala style 20-30 years ago, and is decorated with a foliate design in greys/blacks and rouge, signed "Made in Mexico, Solis"

- 5 1/2" ht. x 5" lg.

name: vintage Hound Hotel
description:
a charming late 1960's "doll house" - though this one's gone to the dogs! A hotel for hounds, made in Germany and sold by F.A.O. Schwartz, it is constructed of plywood with a painted exterior in the style of a Swiss chalet. A removable roof is lifted to expose a simple interior replete with furnishings that include a tiny fireplace, bed and dresser, and a bright red dining table with bench seating. It's occupants include two boy hounds sporting green felt lederhosen and caps, and a girl hound in a French maid's uniform!

- stamped "Made in Germany" inside
- 15 1/4" wd. x 11 1/2" dp. x 8 1/2" ht. overall
- hounds bear labels"Handwork Kunstlerschutz West-Germany"
- has a little paint loss - consistent with age

name: classic seda france japanese quince candles
description:
this candle, redolent with an exotic blend of jasmine, passion fruit and peach, has always been scout's no. 1 best selling gift! regularly $32., on sale for $24.50 while supplies last!

- signature pagoda packaging with toile design that needs no gift wrap
- approximately 60+ burn time
- glass bears lovely etched toile design
- 8" x 3 1/2" in box/candle itself is 4" ht. x 3 1/8" in diameter  

sale items cannot be returned

name: ana pagent tapers
description:
for a modest price - these classic striped candles will take your table from ordinary to high style - and they're on sale! 

- regularly $24. a pair/for limited time $18. a pair!
- 14" ht. x 7/8" round
- made in the USA
- premium quality paraffin wax/100% cotton wick
- 14 hour burn time
- currently available in red/scarlet, taupe/cream and morris green/scarlet

sale items cannot be returned

name: a pair of small scale vintage painted rush seat chairs
description:
the scale of these chairs is small, but the paint decoration gives them big impact - the rush seats have seen quite a bit of wear - note loss on one - but this doesn't stop them from being perfect for stacking books bedside, loading with towels in the bath or providing eye candy in a foyer

- 29 1/4" ht./13 1/4" ht. to seat x 16 3/4" wd. x 13 1/2" dp. 
- hand painted in red, green and blue on a sunflower yellow ground

name: a beautifully carved teak wood bench
description:
this bench is quite long - 79" in length - and has beautiful carving on the splat and well as curving arms carved from the solid - the surface is softly weathered but would darken nicely with an application of tung oil

- 79" lg. x 35 3/4" ht. to top of back/19" to seat x 24" dp.

name: a pair of vintage Indian slipper chairs
description:
if you want to add a dash of bohemian chic to a space, this little pair of chairs is the ticket - circa 1930's/40's, they have fabulously crusty, undisturbed finishes - i.e. lots of wear - and show traces of navy blue, brown and red paint 

- varying slightly in both shape and details of turnings
- 36" ht./15" to top of seat, 18" wd. x 14 1/2" dp.
- one small turning missing from each crest/1/4" wd. gap in boards on seat of one

name: a set of 6 exotic burl wood chairs with clean modern lines
description:
though this a contemporary set of chairs, made of thick cut burl wood, sustainably harvested in Indonesia - we purchased all available and it is likely these were made by an individual craftsman and are a one-of-a-kind set - they have very modern lines, gorgeous figured wood and hand crafted appeal

- 37" ht. to top of curved crest/18" to seat, 17" wd. and 18" dp.
- thick plank seats
- a few stable cracks thru out

name: a vibrant woodblock print "Rooster"
description:
this woodblock print on paper affixed to paper board, with casein paint decoration has a definite mid-century vibe and is a strong graphic rendering of everyone's favorite bird

- signed Morandi and dated 67 along the lower margin in pencil
- image 11 1/4" x 16"
- ships unframed

name: silk and wool paisley shawl
description:
an elegant paisley in silk and wool - to wear or use as a decorative element in an interior

- currently available in charcoal grey/gold
- 30" x 80" 
- reversible
- dry clean only

name: a large modern still life by french painter Didier Grandt
description:
Didier Grandt (French, active 20th century) painted landscapes, figures and more rarely, still lifes. This oil on canvas, affixed to board, is large, exuberant and unmistakably a mid 20th century work - features a barrel of fish, hanging garlic, a basket of potatoes, tomatoes, lemons and pears

- slate blue, greys and blacks, punctuated by pops of bright red and yellows
- signed upper left
- 19 1/2" ht. x 39" wd. 
- unframed

name: "vibrate" a monoprint by Malcolm Bray
description:
this abstraction by the Hunterton County, New Jersey artist, Malcolm Bray (b. Hull, England 1958) is both graphic and abstract, and with it's layering of color and texture, achieves the sense of depth and beauty the artist is noted for.

- on paper affixed to canvas
- signed lower right
- 22 1/2" x 17 3/4" framed
- title on reverse

name: a vintage cast fruit basket centerpiece
description:
though it looks like carved wood, its a charming cast resin fruit basket highlighted with bronze paint - circa 1960's/70's - it would work beautifully as a centerpiece or on a server

- 13" wd. x 6 1/2" dp. x 9 3/4" ht. 
- several small chips

name: a vintage green glass decanter
description:
the perfect pour for your inner james bond - a very mod 1960's/70's green glass decanter with its original stopper 

- 8 1/2" ht. x 4" square 
- a heavy weight, substantial piece

name: a vintage California Pottery pitcher in striking teal glaze
description:
a large teal green glazed pitcher from the California Pottery, circa 1950-60, with neoclassical decoration.

- marked 299B/Calif USA on base
- 9 3/4" ht. x app. 9" wd.
- in great condition with some appropriate wear to surface

name: two vintage Mexican pottery bowls
description:
these hand made bowls have serious style, and though decorated in slightly different hues of blue, work beautifully as a pair

- circa 1940's/50's - with as expected wear - some surface loss on interior of larger bowl and on rim of both
- 10 1/4" in diameter/9 1/4" in diameter
- hand made, decorated and glazed
- not food safe!

name: a pair of glazed pottery centerpieces
description:
a pair of newly minted earthenware decorative pieces, likely italian, in white glaze - stunning table top decor, or placed on a server or mantle

- 14" ht. x 6 3/4" in diameter (base)

name: a 1960's/70's enamel dish with owl in moonlight
description: a little vintage gem - a hand crafted enamel dish, measuring 5 3/4" in diameter, signed by the maker, M.Ratcliff on front, with Stn. Mtn. Ga. written on reverse

name: a litte vintage indian brass and enamel pitcher
description:
a charming little piece, with long narrow neck and red , blue and green enamel foliate decoration

- 8" ht. x 3 1/2" wd.

name: a Ste Jean de Bretagne pottery espresso set
description:
this little set, comprised of an earthenware tray, espresso pot and two cups with saucers, made by the noted French pottery, which was active 1951 thru 1990 - is hand painted in traditional Breton motifs, in bold cobalt blue and white

- signed by the decorator, and stamped with the pottery logo on reverse 
- circa 1970's
- mint condition
- tray is approx. 8" in diameter/espresso pot is 3 1/4" in diameter and 4 1/2" ht./saucers 3 1/2" in diameter and cups are 1 1/2" ht.

name: a vintage amber glass wine jar with original stopper
description:
this wine jar has a fabulous shape punctuated with fluting and a curvey neck - c. 1960's/70's

- 8 3/4" diameter x 6 1/2"ht. 
- clear glass original stopper
- minor wear to lip

name: a vintage small olive glass bowl on stand
description:
a vintage blown glass bowl on a twisted stem on round base - a neat piece of glass in a wonderful olive green

- 7 3/4" ht. x 5 3/8" diameter
- slight imperfections in hand blown glass to be expected and desired

name: a large and vibrant turquoise platter
description:
a newly minted platter, the perfect way to add exotic style to your summer table! Gorgeously hand painted in Nabeul, Tunisia - all paints and glazes are food safe! 

-15" diameter
- fair trade item

name: a large serving bowl in turquoise
description:
a gorgeous bowl, hand painted in Tunisia - so stylish, it could be used simply for display - but it's food safe paint and glaze make it an ideal addition to a summer buffet!

- 16" in diameter x 3 3/4" ht.
- a fair trade item

name: the perfect summer wine holder
description:
another Tunisian beauty, this hand painted cylinder can be used to hold a bottle of wine, or filled with kitchen utensils for a stylish addition to your counter

- 8" ht. x 4 1/4" in diameter
- food safe
- a fair trade item

name: a deep salad bowl in vibrant turquoise
description:
a Tunisian pottery bowl, just the right size for tossing and serving a summer salad, the hand painting and glazing is food safe 

- 12" in diameter x 6 1/2" ht.
- fair trade product

name: Tunisian pottery olive boat
description:
a wildly popular item at scout's earlier bricks and mortar incarnation, these little olive boats add a splash of color to cocktail hour - and make a terrific hostess gift!

- 16" lg. x 1 1/2" ht.
- food safe 
- a fair trade item

name: a vintage hand blown amber glass pitcher
description:
a wonderful piece of colored glass from the 70's - the clean lines and full shape make it a  wonderful addition to any tablescape

- 11 1/2" ht. x x 5 1/2" in diameter

name: two fanciful enamelware boxes
description:
these tiny brass boxes are magic - sold as a pair, they are decorated with a pink lion (on oval) and a folkloric design (round)

- round is 1"/oval is 1 1/4" wd.
- 20 or 30 years old

name: antique copper bowl on stand
description:
an antique copper bowl on stand with decorative stamped details, fluted edge and a wonderfully distressed surface

- circa 1920's/30's
- 8 3/8" x 7" diameter

name: vintage folk art candle holder
description:
a hand made redware candleholder, glazed in olive greens - a classic mexican form, a tree of life, with flowers, leaves, berries and doves affixed with wire

- 8" ht. x 8" wd.

name: a vintage brass tray with islamic decoration
description:
exotic and highly decorative tray made of heavy brass - ready for hanging or could be used tabletop

- circa 1940's/50's
- 13 5/8" in diameter

name: a moroccan parade gun
description:
we think this wooden rifle, strictly decorative, is the height of exotic cool - embellished with punched tin, hand painted bone and nail head detail, has a wrought iron "mechanism" and would look amazing mounted

- 63" lg. x 8 1/2" wide at base

name: a carved wooden owl
description:
a folk artist's interpretation of an owl that's simple and charming, and intentionally askew - circa 1950s/60s

- 10" ht. x 5" wd.

name: a raku pottery vase with abstract bird forms
description:
a unique art pottery piece, circa 1960s/70s, decorated with abstracted birds in soft blues, greys and off-white

- 6 1/2" ht. x 6" wd.
- signed "BROOMY"? with the number 6636

name: cast concrete owl and owlet
description:
more owls! a cute and clever momma and owlet of cast concrete for your doorstep or table

-8 1/2" wd. x 8" ht. x 6" dp.

name: newly minted small transferware glass cloches
description:
classic domes were originally made to protect small plants from the cold - these newly minted versions, one beautifully decorated with a bird and nest full of eggs and a quote "live nobly", the other with images of the eiffel tower, french stamps and "paris", can be used to cover candles, a dish filled with soaps or placed tabletop, just so

- each 8" ht x 5" in diameter

name: two vintage enamelware pieces from persia
description:
two examples of exquisite hand decorated enamel work, persian, circa 1930's - pieces are adorned with mille fleur designs, with tiny hand painted birds and small landscapes

- bowl - 7 1/2" in diameter x 3 1/4" ht. - loss on foot and rim/predominant interior colors are cobalt blue - rim, purple and green/black and white exterior
- plate - 8 1/8" in diameter - loss in rim and bend in lower left - predominant colors are green, purple and black
- not food safe! decorative only

name: newly minted large transferware glass cloche
description:
classic domes were originally made to protect small plants from the cold - this newly minted version, beautifully decorated with an ode to friendship and pen work design, can be used to cover candles, a dish filled with soaps or placed tabletop, just so

- 11" ht x 6 1/4" in diameter
- would make a lovely statement gift

name: a nest of mexican trays
description:
a nest of four mexican terra cotta trays in descending scale - 11" x 8" thru 7" x 3 3/4" - different graphic designs in blues and greens hand painted on outside of each piece

- not food safe!
- would be fantastic filled with jewelry or displayed on a desk with pens etc.

name: a folk art carving of a man
description:
a quirky bust of a man carved from a solid piece of wood

- a nail protruding from top and several cracks only add to the character of the piece
- 13 3/4" ht. x 8" wd. 
- can't say much about the origin - it's just whacky and cool

name: a bracelet of zebra wood and mother of pearl
description:
a statement piece, large and striking, to wear all spring and summer long - pieces of mother of pearl, mounted on various sized rectangles of zebra wood - connected on an elasticized cord

- 3 3/8" wd. at it's widest point

name: a stunning mother of pearl bracelet
description:
the perfect bracelet to pack for that beach vacation - slender fragments of mother of pearl, joined on an elasticized cord - large and stylish - newly minted by monies usa

- 2 1/2" wide at widest point

name: vintage ikat fragment
description:
saturated color and an exhuberant pattern characterize this vintage ikat fragment, suitable for framing, use as a table runner or for fabricating a pillow cover

- oxblood ground - 42 3/4" lg. x 16" wd.
- slightly uneven border

name: 2nd vintage ikat fragment
description:
saturated color and a large dot pattern characterize this vintage ikat fragment, suitable for framing, use as a table runner or for fabricating one or more pillow covers

- 64" lg x 16" wd.
- slightly uneven borders

name: 3rd vintage ikat
description:
saturated color and an exuberant pattern characterize this vintage ikat fragment, suitable for framing or for fabricating a pillow cover

- 26" lg. x 16" wd.
- slightly uneven borders

name: 4th vintage ikat fragment
description:
saturated color and an exuberant pattern characterize this vintage ikat fragment, suitable for framing, use as a table runner or for fabricating a pillow cover

- 50 1/2" lg. 17" wd.
- slightly uneven borders

name: felted wool suzani tote
description:
not your typical tote - offering loads of style and charm along with practicality, this tote is made in India of felted wool and is embellished on front and back with an exuberant suzani design

- trimmed in solid colored cotton, that's also used for coordinating lining (quilted) and shoulder straps
- two inside pockets and an outside pocket on either end
- 18" wd. x 13 1/4" ht. x 6" dp. with 12" straps
- red/charcoal grey, lavender/charcoal grey and chartreuse/black
note: turquoise/brown sold out

sale items cannot be returned

name: a one of a kind scout designed Chinese turquoise necklace
description:
with a decidedly western vibe, this necklace features an oval faux bone carving of an American indian head, on a strand of chunky, rough cut Chinese turquoise, terminating in a sterling silver leaf clasp 

- oval pendant is 2 1/4" wd. x 1 1/4" ht.
- 16" long overall

name: bird in heart beaded necklace
description:
a one of a kind beaded necklace ornamented with a bird in heart charm by metal artist jennifer may

- brass charm mounted on hammered nickel silver
- hand made in pennsylvania
- pendant is 3" overall 
- it hangs on a 15 1/2" strand of alternating apple green and black stone beads

name: running chicken necklace
description:
a unique, hand crafted necklace by metal artist jennifer may, whose whimsical animals never fail to delight! This piece features a running chicken in nickel silver and copper 

- hand made in pennsylvania
- pendant is 2 1/2" wd. x 2 1/4" ht.
- it hangs on an 18" rubber cord with a magnetic clasp
- signed with artist's initials on back

name: donkey necklace
description:
a necklace by metal artist jennifer may with a little brass donkey posed on a copper disk that's mounted on a hammered nickel silver square - the perfect gift for your fav donkey lover and/or democrat

- hand made in pennsylvania
- 1 5/8" overall 
- it hangs on a 24" ball chain

name: a one-of-a-kind carnelian agate necklace by sandrhyme jewelry
description:
big chunky teardrop shapes in carnelian agate adorn this 22" statement necklace by the puget sound jewelry workshop, sandrhyme

- tiny brass coils separate stones
- clasp is nickel silver
- each piece by sandrhyme is unique
- made in the us

name: bun necklace
description:
a little brass bunny runs on a copper disk on this charming necklace by metal artist jennifer may

- hand made in pennsylvania
- measuring 2" wd. x 1 1/2" ht.
 - suspended on a 24" ball chain

name: stripey necklace
description:
a striped kitty in nickel silver and copper is featured in this one of a kind construction by metal artist jennifer may, whose hand made pieces are characterized by simple stylized forms and lots of whimsy

- hand made in pennsylvania
- pendant is 3" wd. x 3" ht.
- it hangs on an 18" rubber cord with a magnetic clasp
- signed with artists initials on reverse

name: bee in an oval necklace
description:
a little brass bee adorns a copper oval - by metal artist jennifer may

- hand made in pennsylvania
- pendant is 2" ht. x 1" wd.
- it hangs on a 26" ball chain

name: felted wool suzani tote in additional colors
description:
two new color combinations are available in our wildly stylish and roomy tote - chartreuse/black and violet/charcoal grey!

sale items cannot be returned

name: bee on hammered brass necklace
description:
a little copper bee charm is the feature of this hand made necklace by metal artist jennifer may

- hand made in pennsylvania
- mounted on a hammered brass square 
- 1 1/4" square
- it hangs on a 24" ball chain

name: bird in flight necklace
description:
a hammered nickel silver and copper bird soars on this charming necklace by metal artist jennifer may

- hand made in pennsylvania
- pendant is 2" wd. x1 1/8" ht. 
- ships on 18" rubber chord with magnetic clasp
- signed with artist's initials on reverse

name: a delicate tear drop rutilated quartz neckace
description:
this piece was made by hand at sandrhyme jewelry workshop in puget sound and features lovely rutilated quarz tear drop stones and brass barrel and coil beads

- 18" in length
- hand made in the us
- gorgeous worn alone or in combination with other pieces

name: camel necklace
description:
a little brass camel rides on a copper triangle, mounted on nickel silver  - a one of a kind construction by metal artist jennifer may

- hand made in pennsylvania 
- pendant measures 1 3/4" wd. x 1 1/2 " ht.
- suspended on a 29" ball chain

name: a large vintage woven mexican saltillo rug
description:
this rug is stunning - the real deal, circa 1940 - with just the right vibrancy - and in great condition with intact fringe - a big punch of style for not a lot of money

- 94" lg. x 63" wd. 
- reversible

name: a vintage small mexican saltillo blanket/rug
description:
a beautiful little textile, circa 1940, the colors still vibrant - finely and tightly woven with intact fringe - would make hip and original table runner!

- 36 1/2" lg. x 18" wd.

name: eco-friendy throw in ikat pattern
description:
made of recycled cotton yarn, these colorful throws offer style and comfort while reducing waste from large textile manufacturers that would otherwise enter landfills

- 50" x 60"
- currently available in red with milk and warm pink
- machine wash and dry

name: eco-friendy throw in chevron pattern
description:
made of recycled cotton yarn, these colorful throws offer style and comfort while reducing waste from large textile manufacturers that would otherwise enter landfills

- 50" x 60" 
- currently available in milk/spice
- machine wash and dry

name: eco-friendly birdy throw
description:
made of recycled cotton yarn, these colorful throws offer style and comfort while reducing waste from large textile manufacturers that would otherwise enter landfills

- 50" x 60"
- currently available in artichoke/milk
- machine wash and dry

name: a vintage aquamarine glass compote
description:
a lovely little piece of brightly colored hand blown glass - and in a desirable compote form

- 7 1/2" ht. x 8" in diameter

name: eco-friendly throw in Morocco pattern
description:
made of recycled cotton yarn, these colorful throws offer style and comfort while reducing waste from large textile manufacturers that would otherwise enter landfills

- 50" x 60"
- currently available in spice/pomegranate
- machine wash and dry

name: eco-friendly throw in birch pattern
description:
made of recycled cotton yarn, these colorful throws offer style and comfort while reducing waste from large textile manufacturers that would otherwise enter landfills

- 50" x 60"
- currently available in pond blue with red cardinal
- machine wash and dry

name: vintage Russian doll
description:
one of those charming Russian nesting dolls - eight hand painted rosy cheeked ladies - descending in size from 7" high to 1 1/2" high - colorful and fun as a group displayed on a shelf

- made in USSR label on bottom confirms vintage date
- a crack on reverse of two of eight

name: whimsical folk art carving of man, dog and raccoon
description:
this is funky personified - a folk art carving of a man, a hound dog and a raccoon - the last apparently having taken refuge up a tree  

- the carver's initials and the date "92" carved on reverse
- the panel is 8 1/2" wd. x 10 7/8" ht.

name: pair of little vintage brass candlesticks
description:
this pair of little candle holders is small in stature, but big on bling!

- made of brass with inset cabochon and faceted plastic beads 
- 5 1/2" ht. x 4 1/2" wd.
- some wear to brass candle arm caps

name: a large moo cow trade sign
description:
a vintage cow sign, hand painted on plywood, circa 1950's/60's - would have lived outside and has appropriate weathering with some paint loss, but no loss of character!

- could easily be wired for hanging
- 39" ht. x 23 1/4" wd.

name: art glass girl
description:
a little redheaded girl in glass by award winning american glass artist carolyn schlam - full of color and charm

- the figure is 9" ht. x 4" wd. and rests on a wooden base that's 6 1/2" lg. x 3" wd.
- signed by artist on reverse

name: an assemblage of six hand painted tiles
description:
someone with a truly individual style, hand painted this series of tiles - each 6" x 6" - with images of exotic animals and lands

- the six tiles are mounted on a plywood panel - 12" x 18" 
- wired for hanging
- these tiles were hand painted and glazed and show appropriate imperfections associated with hand made tiles
- would be a fabulous addition to a nursery or child's room

name: the cutest mobile home ever
description:
you or your little one, can carry this felted wool home along for play dates, filling the zippered compartment with toys, for overnights toting pjs or park it on a shelf for storage of various preciouses

- 12" ht. x 8 1/2" wd. x 7" dp.
- sturdy zipper with felted wool toggle - help for little hands
- each lined in white rayon
- the designers are Danish and the houses are hand made in Nepal using sustainable production and fair trade practices

- currently available in turquoise and green

name: vintage tea party
description:
a little vintage (1960's) vignette that includes a table and chair set in oak, two dapper mice, and a ceramic tea set in white with red and blue dot decoration

- the table - 4" in diameter x 2 1/8" ht. and two chairs - 2 5/8" ht. are stamped Toncoss/Sturbridge
- the bendable mice bear labels - "Handwork/Kunstlerschutz/West Germany" and wear felt pants and linen shirts
- the ceramic tea set bears a label "MADE IN GERMANY/US ZONE"

name: two fanciful hand made glass pulls by carolyn schlam
description:
these two little guys just make you smile! these pulls are hand made constructions by award winning glass artist carolyn schlam - though clearly not identical - they could easily be used together on closet doors in a child's room, for a touch of whimsy

- one is 2 1/4" x 2" and the other is 3 1/2" x 1 3/4"

name: a set of three quirky antique school girl drawings, circa 1920
description:
this little collection, the work of one individual with a completely unique style, is one of our all time favorite finds! referred to as "school girl" drawings, as they're the creation of young women with little or no formal training in art, the artist usually goes unidentified 

- the three include renderings of a bull dog, with the word "Bull" in script on low left - the image measuring 7 1/4" ht. x 4 5/8" wd./11" ht. x 8 1/4" wd. framed, a girl with a red ribbon in her hair with a horse wearing same - image 4 1/2" ht. x 7" wd./8 1/4" x 10 7/8" framed, and a girl wearing a beret feeding a walnut to a squirrel with writing on lower left that includes "by W B.B." - image 7 1/4" x 4 5/8"/11" ht. x 8 1/4" wd. framed
- all sketched in pencil and then drawn in blue or black and red pen and ink
- all on ruled paper and all under glass with slate blue mats in handsome ebonized wood frames with egg and dart and rosette detail 
- small tear on girl with squirrel/folds appear on all three/several smudges
